text:
You have a cow whenever you hear “congratulations on your company raising Series A.” :face_with_rolling_eyes:

Not because you aren’t happy about your status as the CMO of a Series A company. But because you’re scared.

Who wouldn’t? 

20 - 30% of software companies experience a higher churn rate after receive funding. 

The average tenure of CMOs keeps reducing by the year. 

Stakeholders expect you to close deals and generate revenue while maintaining the highly coveted $0 acquisition cost.

Crazy. 

Even worse, your marketing strategy focused on traffic generation and lead magnets isn’t promising anymore.

So what’s the better alternative?

Product-Led Marketing.

Product-Led Marketing involves using your product to attract, acquire Product-Qualified Leads (those who have experienced your product's value either by a free trial or a freemium model), and activate customers. 

In this guide, I share how to develop and implement a Product-Led Marketing strategy. Get ready to steer your company to Series B and possibly an acquisition. 

Read here :point_down:

 <https://victoreduoh.com/product-led-marketing-a-guide-for-series-a-cmos/|https://victoreduoh.com/product-led-marketing-a-guide-for-series-a-cmos/>

attachments.fallback: VEC | Product-led storytelling SaaS content agency: Product-Led Marketing: A No-Nonsense Guide for Series A CMOs
attachments.text: Looking to achieve top-line growth for your Series A SaaS startup? Here are Product-Led Marketing tips to help you.
attachments.title: Product-Led Marketing: A No-Nonsense Guide for Series A CMOs
